poem:
### The Detour

On roads cross-country,  
Tom measures years—  
a C-minus tally of life.

The sun gleams off asphalt,  
whispers of youth,  
silent departures.

In the rearview, familiar shadows  
dissolve into horizon.  
Love's burden shifts,  
unbuckled. A journey anew,  
with a map still folded  
in the glove box.
